title: (x) sans text face with curved 'y' - Post Office Sans (custom font by Jason Smith) {James, Yves}
content:
This sample was sent to me to see if I could ID this text font. I searched my Sans Font ID Guide and (arbitrarily) the sans fonts at Veer, and came up with nothing that matched. The 'y' is about the only oddball letter I can see here. T-26 Flux matches the general shapes, but the details are not the same.

Anyone recognize this one?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font-id2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20101126153603/http:/typophile.com/files/font-id2.gif) | 37.93 KB |
author: bowfinpw

comments.content: This is a custom font for the Post Office brand subsidiary of the Royal Mail called Post Office Sans. Don't know much more than that though. Sorry.

Thanks James and Yves. That will answer it quite nicely, even if that wasn't the hoped-for answer.

- Mike Yanega
